goalForm.createSubtitle: Define your investment goal using the SMART framework

step1.title: What's your goal?
step1.subtitle: Be specific about what you want to achieve. A clear goal is the first step to success.
step1.titlePlaceholder: e.g., House down payment, Emergency fund, Dream vacation
step1.titleError: Please enter a goal title (at least 3 characters)
step1.descriptionPlaceholder: Describe your goal in detail. What exactly do you want to achieve? The more specific, the better.
step1.descriptionError: Please be specific about your goal (at least 20 characters)
step1.smartTipText: Instead of "save money", try "Save $50,000 for a down payment on a 3-bedroom house in Austin". Specific goals are easier to plan and track.

step2.title: Set your target
step2.subtitle: How much do you need to achieve this goal?
step2.amountError: Please enter a valid amount greater than 0
step2.smartTipText: Giving your goal a specific dollar amount makes it real. You can't track progress towards "saving some money", but you can track progress towards $10,000.

step3.title: When do you need it?
step3.subtitle: Set a realistic deadline. A goal without a date is just a dream.
step3.dateError: Please select a date in the future
step3.smartTipText: A deadline creates a sense of urgency and helps you calculate exactly how much you need to save each month to reach your goal.

step4.title: Categorize your goal
step4.subtitle: Which bucket does this goal fit into? This helps determine the right investment strategy.
step4.smartTipText: Different goals require different investment strategies. Safety goals need low risk. Growth goals balance risk and reward. Dream goals can afford higher risk.

step5.title: Why does this matter?
step5.subtitle: Connect your goal to an emotional anchor. This is what will keep you going when saving gets tough.
step5.whyPlaceholder: e.g., I want to provide financial security for my family, or I want to have the freedom to travel the world.
step5.smartTipText: A relevant goal matters to you and aligns with your other relevant goals. If the goal isn't important, you won't stick to it.
step5.example1: To have peace of mind knowing I can handle unexpected expenses.
step5.example2: To build a legacy for my children and their education.
step5.example3: To enjoy my retirement years without financial stress.
step5.example4: To have the freedom to pursue my passion projects.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: FinGoal is committed to protecting your privacy. This policy explains what data we collect, why we collect it, and how you can control it.

localData.heading: Your Goal Data (Local Only)
localData.body: All financial goals you create are stored exclusively in your browser's localStorage. This data never leaves your device and is not transmitted to any server.

analytics.heading: Anonymous Analytics
analytics.body: If you consent, we collect anonymous page view data via Vercel Analytics. This includes pages visited and general usage patterns. No personally identifiable information (PII) is collected. Analytics can be declined using the consent banner.

howWeUse.title: How We Use Data
howWeUse.body: Your local goal data is used solely to display your goals within the application. Anonymous analytics data (when consented) is used to understand which features are most useful so we can improve the product.

dataSharing.title: Data Sharing
dataSharing.body: We do not sell, trade, or share your personal data with third parties. Anonymous analytics data is processed by Vercel, whose privacy policy is available at vercel.com/legal/privacy-policy.

retention.title: Data Retention & Deletion
retention.body: Your goal data is stored in your browser until you clear it. To delete all your data, clear your browser's localStorage for this site (browser Settings → Privacy → Clear browsing data). Your analytics consent preference is also stored in localStorage and can be reset in the same way.

yourRights.title: Your Rights
yourRights.body: You have the right to access, correct, or delete your data at any time. Since all data is stored locally in your browser, you have full control. You may withdraw analytics consent at any time by clearing localStorage.

contact.title: Contact
contact.body: For privacy-related questions, please open an issue on our GitHub repository.

service.body: FinGoal is a free tool that helps you define, organize, and visualize personal financial goals using the SMART framework and the 3 Buckets methodology. The service is provided as-is for informational and organizational purposes.

notAdvice.title: Not Financial Advice
notAdvice.body: FinGoal is not a licensed financial advisor, broker, or investment service. Nothing on this platform constitutes financial, investment, tax, or legal advice. Always consult a qualified professional before making investment decisions. Past performance is not indicative of future results.

userResponsibilities.title: User Responsibilities
userResponsibilities.body: You are responsible for the accuracy of the goals and data you enter. You agree not to use FinGoal for any unlawful purpose. You are responsible for maintaining the security of your device and browser.
